content: a free version is available on my blog a shawl design with a beautiful drape using only 400m of fingering weight yarn a beautiful skein of yarn is all that is needed to show off this light and lacy shawl pattern a wide wingspan to curl around your neck and shoulders - lovely as a summer wrap or a cosy scarf in colder months made using basic crochet stitches that combine to create an interesting pattern that is relaxing and quick to crochet includes a us and uk crochet terms version of pattern includes a crochet chart **materials** green elephant yarn fingering weight /437yds 400m non-sw merino wool/100gr in colourway little fictions 4 5mm crochet hook or whatever hook size gives a loose gauge you can use 400m of any fingering weight yarn or yarn weight of your choice and matching hook **measurements** shawl measures 72 in 189cm length x 22 in 59cm depth
